iasgaich ... air allt ... fishes on a burn –
Thàinig Màiri agus Seumas gu allt agus thòisich Seumas air iasgach.
Mary and James came to a burn and James started fishing. td. 76

thig ... gu allt ... comes to a burn –
Thàinig Màiri agus Seumas gu allt agus thòisich Seumas air iasgach.
Mary and James came to a burn and James started fishing. td. 76

allt ann am monadh a burn on a moor –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Thàinig iad gu allt agus thòisich Seumas air iasgach. Cha do ghlac Seumas breac ach fhuair Màiri nead anns an fhraoch.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] They came to a burn and James started fishing. James didn’t catch a trout but Mary found a nest in the heather. td. 76

breac ann an allt a trout in a burn –
Bha Màiri agus Seumas anns a’ mhonadh an dé. [...] Thàinig iad gu allt agus thòisich Seumas air iasgach. Cha do ghlac Seumas breac ach fhuair Màiri nead anns an fhraoch.
Mary and James were on the moor yesterday. [...] They came to a burn and James started fishing. James didn’t catch a trout but Mary found a nest in the heather. td. 76

torman uillt a stream’s murmur(ing) –
Bha an crodh blàth le teas na gréine agus bha iad ’nan seasamh anns na lochan beaga a bha an siud ’s an seo air feadh a’ mhonaidh. Bha na h-uain bheaga a’ leum agus a’ cluich mu thimcheall am màthraichean. Bha torman an uillt a’ dèanamh ciùil ann an cluais Chaluim bhig.
The cattle were warm with the heat of the sun and they were standing in the little lakes which were here and there throughout the moor. The little lambs were jumping and playing about their mothers. The murmur of the burn was making music in little Malcolm’s ear. td. 146
